title: Castle Semple Walk Route

images.title: Richard Webb / Kilbarchan loop, Castle Semple
images.caption: Kilbarchan loop, Castle Semple. The railway was built in 1905 to provide extra capacity and relieve what is the remaining railway east of Castle Semple Loch. Much of its course is through cuttings. Now a cycle path. Railway is also known as the Lochwinnoch Loop or Dalry and North Johnstone Line.

images.title: Richard Webb / Wetland flowers, Castle Semple Loch
images.caption: Wetland flowers, Castle Semple Loch

images.title: Richard Webb / National Cycle Route 7, Castle Semple
images.caption: National Cycle Route 7. Cycle path built on the relief railway which once provided extra capacity for goods moving between Paisley and Ayrshire. Closed to passengers in 1966.

images.title: Richard Webb / Temple
images.caption: Temple. 18th century folly on Kenmure Hill. According to the interpretation board on the disused railway which passes close by, this is a folly possibly built as a deer look out post on the Castle Semple Estate in 1760.

images.title: Richard Webb / Boat hire, Castle Semple Loch
images.caption: Boat hire. A variety of craft available for hire by the country park visitor centre.

description: Castle Semple country park is located in the Clyde Muirshiel Regional Park at Lochwinnoch, Renfrewshire. This route starts at the visitor centre and takes you alongside Castle Semple Loch before joining woodland trails to Park Hill. Cyclists can enjoy the lochside path which runs along National Cycle Route 7 from Glasgow to Irvine while the woodland trails are more suitable for walkers. At the southern end of the loch you will find the Lochwinnoch RSPB Nature Reserve where you can look out for a variety of wildlife from the bird hides.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: The Lochwinnoch Cycle Loop runs past the park and is a great way of extending your exercise. The shared cycling and walking trail runs along a disused railway line between Kilbirnie to Paisley. It's a nice surfaced path with views over Barr Loch and Castle Semple Loch to enjoy on the way. Head north and you can continue your lochside walking around the tranquil Knapps Loch in Kilmacolm .
